website_summaries.verdict: Designed to take advantage of modern 4K/HDR formats like HDR10+ and Dolby Vision, this player delivers a cinema-like experience.
pros: Displays vivid colors and stark lighting contrasts
Supports popular streaming apps and Alexa controls
cons: This premium player is a fairly pricy model

customer_reviews.title: The Best Player on the Market.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best player on the market for movies. It accurately maps colors. The HDR Optimizer allows you to perfectly dial in spectral detail so you don’t have over blown bright scenes or overly dark shadows. If you have a projector this is the only player you should consider buying. It is a waste if money to by any other player. The only difference between the UB820 and the UB9000 is the 9000 has a dedicated power supply for the audio stage, it has upgraded DAC for stereo audio listening (not movies), and it has a metal case. So if you are not doing high end stereo listening there is no need for the 9000.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Family

customer_reviews.title: I want My Money Back!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed I cannot get the unit to work with Amazon Alex. Won't recognize unit and says pairing required after the app has been enabled. Spent over an hour on the phone with Amazon Alexa support, who supposedly escalated to 2nd level support its been over 3 weeks and haven't heard or gotten a solution fix. Forget trying to contact Panasonic. Theres no US contract numbers, or email. I created a Panasonic profile on their server however, when I try to login the page responses by saying "user ID or password are invalid. Wish I could return this very expensive player!
customer_reviews.author: Papa D

customer_reviews.title: product is problematic and doesn't work right!
customer_reviews.text: The product is problematic and doesn't work right! 1. Movies cannot be heard via USB! 2. Amazon streaming only 2 channels in PCM voice 3. There is no technical support for Panasonic 820 ! 4. Hard disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stunning picture, but 15-year old user interface
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Panasonic BD10AK (2007), a BDT500 (2012), and now I moved to 4K with the UB820 (2019). The UB820 totally delivers when it comes to HDR, Dolby Vision, and amazing 4K visuals. Where things fall WAY short in 2019 standards is the user interface that hasn't noticeably changed since the 2007 model. The UI has gotten faster but is laughably basic by 2020 standards. I have an old (but amazing) Denon AVR so I use the analog output which is one solid reason to choose an option like this at this relatively high price. Analog audio works great and the DTS sound tracks are breathtaking. Due to the outdated user interface, you probably should look at other options.
customer_reviews.author: J. York

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Video/Audio Out issue
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up to my Yamaha receiver video/audio out to Receiver AV1 HDMI port. TV hooked up to Receiver (ARC) 1 HDMI port. I could hear a DVD playback but no video, no DVD player setup on my TV. TV wouldn’t even recognize the DVD player as Panasonic. Said “Unknown”. If I used the video only HDMI on the DVD player the TV would recognize the Panasonic DVD player but of course wouldn’t show video. Pretty sure the DVD player Video/Audio out HDMI was faulty. Sent back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful playback of all media.
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular! Wonderful. This unit replaces a Samsung player a couple years old. The Panasonic is providing a much improved picture and better sound than my old machine. In addition, it even plays ordinary DVDs reasonably well. Not 4K quality, but not pixelated garbage like the Samsung. Definitely an advance in my viewing experience. Worth the money. Plenty of options for connecting to your TV and sound equipment. I highly recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: J. Piwaron

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k player overall
customer_reviews.text: Best 4k blu ray at the mid range price point. It covers most people's needs with HDR10+ and Dolby Vision support, 4k upscaling, usb connection for most of your content, some audio files are not supported but most are. Still you get more bang for your buck. It basically has the power of the high end model with a less of quality build quality also a plus for me is that the Netflix app supports dolby atmos unlike most of Netflix apps in a smart TV which is where I typically watch Netflix thru, so if you like Netflix originals which alot are in Dolby atmos you love the app in this player.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique M1

customer_reviews.title: Reliable UHD player
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a reliable UHD player, and that's what the Panasonic UB820 is. It's performance is excellent. It supports Dolby Vision, and delivers everything you expect from a very good player. The only thing I didn't like is the remote control. Most of all, the lack of a subtitle dedicated button. But I'm very happy with it. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bayard

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one. Get the Sony X800M2 instead
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction, constant hand shake issues with LG OLED C9, horrible remote control, somewhat noisy, and slow loading. These are the reasons I sent it back for a refund. For $500 dollars I expected better. I'll Stick with my Sony X800M2 because I didn't have any problems with the listed issues above. Plus I get SACD comparability and DVD audio. The Panasonic is not worth double the cost of the Sony by any measure. If there is one thing that the Panasonic UB820 beats the Sony, and not by much, is the picture quality on 4k blu rays. The tone mapping feature is noticable, but again not worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: T. Barahona

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic failed for the last time...going back to sony.
customer_reviews.text: When it was working it was fine. Now that it’s outside the return window, this POC has failed to play repeatedly even after factory resetting it. It just keeps reading then goes back to home page. NOW it can’t run any streaming service. I have a sony uhd 4k sitting right under it at half the price working just find...waste if $450.00!
customer_reviews.author: John Doran

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in 4K and HDR
customer_reviews.text: I tried two of these and neither would work with my new Sony 4K OLED. Could not get HDR and 4K working. Also it requires 2 (count'em, two) HDMI cables one for video, one for sound if you want 4K and HDR. Funny, my top of the line Roku streamer works fine with one.
customer_reviews.author: mbx1

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional DVD and Blu-Ray playback
customer_reviews.text: I have used this player only for DVD and Blu-Ray playback. I have not other features. For DVD and Blu-Ray I am very very pleased. The picture is exceptional on a Sony A9G flagship OLED television. Much to my surprise, it replaced my beloved Oppo BDP-93.
customer_reviews.author: G Jo

customer_reviews.title: Set up was not difficult
customer_reviews.text: Need to read the user manual in detail as many useful features. The remote is back lite and has many buttons for all the options. Easy to use. The picture quality details and sound is better then my old 4k Samsung player. Also sounds great when playing high quality CD's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is  Junk
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but junk I played 10 of my Blu-rays that are in perfect condition 7 of them kept freezy Never buy another Panasonic again
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Really like the ease of use (at least for me) and the quality. My Sony just stopped working mid-movie (literally). I've had this for a while now and no complaints. The apps are kind of a disappointment but I have a smart t.v. and a roku for my projector so that part of the player is irrelevant to me - is it to you? If not look for another player. Set up was easy and the picture is better than my Sony.
customer_reviews.author: the artist formerly known as Movie, freak

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with Samsung tv
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to try functionality for long because when I connected the HDMI cable to my Samsung tv, the HDMI port for my Fios DVR disappeared from the tv screen and I couldn't watch regular tv until I unplugged the HDMI from the blu-ray player. Happened no matter which combination of ports I tried and the problem remained even when the player was off. My old $70 Sony blu-ray player does not have the problem so it's not my tv and it's not the Fios DVR and its not the HDMI cable; its the Panasonic UB820.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Petko

customer_reviews.title: One of the best available but ...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for most, can only play on one region but you can buy the region free hack from Rattlebyte if you know how to solder. Comparable replacement to the Oppo(still available for $2k). Amazon Warehouse sent an open box instead of the "Like new" where the packaging was bad but basically brand new. It works and seems to be clean out of the box but definitely used. You can bu the remote from the DP-UB9004 if you need more buttons but those are rare/expensive to buy. I got one for $80 on fleabay. I got a really good deal from camecamel alerts for this player so its good.
customer_reviews.author: dtd3cebu

customer_reviews.title: No better than the similar unit 4 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Does not decode a lot of the latest video & audio formats. If you turn off the player in the middle of a HD movie, it does not remember the position in the movie. Very disappointed that these have not been upgraded in years
customer_reviews.author: Wolfensteed

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy! Has issues.
customer_reviews.text: Control panel stays displayed on screen and can't be removed. Don't buy. It worked for 3 months only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great priced 4k player
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best 4k player out there under $1000, it plays 4 k discs very accurately and it does a very good job at upscaling blurays and DVDs. It is a very resonably priced player, Great job Panasonic!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Worked well with my Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung TV is able to recognize the player and turn it on and off. That's probably more to do with communication standards. The remote is not working completely with my TV, so I suspect I need to configure it somehow. The picture is fantastic, the discs load fast enough for me (I don't know what's considered fast or slow). It feels like a solid machine too. I look forward to buying audio gear soon and testing the whole thing. RIght now, i just use my TV audio.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The HDR optimizer is amazing
customer_reviews.text: The picture and sound are incredible! The adjustments for 4k HDR are excellent especially if watched on a projector. It plays nearly any disc,but it will not do SACDs or dvd audio discs. The remote is good but is not backlit;it is hard to use in a dark room. Overall,it’s picture quality and sound quality are second to none. It’s price is very reasonable. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: leonard b  gerson

customer_reviews.title: With Oppo gone this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Quick to load and play. Works seamlessly with my Marantz 7703 to the new LG 65" OLED. Wonderful picture. Plenty of options. Zero issues in 4 months of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: Buy new
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this used I revived the I order and it didn’t turn on I just wasted my time and money and at the end had order a new one; Let see how it does.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: YUP. FINALLY TRUE CINEPHILE VIDEO
customer_reviews.text: My ONLY complaints are about the inconvenience of TWO HDMI cables, one for video and one for audio. This is really a whine, as it is the means to deliver the improved vibrance is HDR. But it also necessitates considersble re-thought when using a home theatre sound system. Geez.
customer_reviews.author: Urbana Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a great Panasonic Blue-Ray player in hopes the reviews were true. They were!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. I think one of the biggest improvements is the dual HDMI outputs. One for audio and another for video. Both were clearer and cleaner. I also like the easy access to my favorite streaming apps provided on the remote. I gave it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Stanford Mason

customer_reviews.title: Alexa?
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit and would buy it again and recommend it, but; after 2 days of trying to get Alexa to connect I give up! I'll just use the remote. It would have been really nice and convenient to get Alexa to work. So, I'll probably use Alexa for streaming rather than this player. Watched the new Lion King as my first movie on this player and it was fantastic!!! So, I'm happy with it as a player only.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I had 2 Sony 4k Blu-ray players that constantly froze the movies; so frustrating. So I decided to try this one instead.. I must say so far it's great in every way. The setup was a piece of cake and the picture is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to improve the Sony 900F TV with dolby vision and HDR. Would rate 5 star but had a few glitches. One 4K movie froze half way through but I was able to skip that section and finish the movie. This seemed to have happened only on one movie so far. Improved the sound guality to our Sony sound bar as well.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic , can get all money.
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about the 4K blu-ray player, picture , features, specifications, only dislike the build quality could’ve been better.
customer_reviews.author: NYTE 45

customer_reviews.title: BEST on the MARKET, but the REMOTE SUCKS BIG TIME
customer_reviews.text: The REMOTE SUCKS BIG TIME, AWKWARD to HOLD, THING is OUT of PLACE. TOTALLY STUPID.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Showing

customer_reviews.title: PAL discs will not play NTSC only.
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem is this player will not play Region Free PAL discs. Also the Netflix button is in a bad position on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Tom E Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype!
customer_reviews.text: This thing transformed my old 1080P TV, streaming never looked so good, not to mention the Blueray and DVDs. Even the sound through my old 5.1 system is amazing now. Breathed new life into my old system! It is more expensive than other options, but worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Great first time purchase of 4K player
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t disappointed for the price because if you upgrade from this model to the next, will probably spend twice as much$$$
customer_reviews.author: ADAM BRUCE

customer_reviews.title: Best player at the price point
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. It does what the reviews said it would. It is the best player you can buy for real world money.
customer_reviews.author: eleckh

customer_reviews.title: DVD with digital display
customer_reviews.text: Checked out several, none less expensive had a display on the unit.
customer_reviews.author: kettelkamp

customer_reviews.title: excellent playet
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this 4K player except accessing the closed caption subtitles not easy to bring up & use during disc playback
customer_reviews.author: livewire007

customer_reviews.title: Many features, multi format player
customer_reviews.text: Incredible machine!! The audio is off the charts!! My music discs from mp3 to cd sound incredible and less harsh sounding than other players!! HDR and DOLBY VISION look fantastic and was just what I needed to pop the performance from my T.V.
customer_reviews.author: lee w.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Easy interface for USB movies
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Ridgeway

customer_reviews.title: There is no better unit for playing blue rays and 4K discs!
customer_reviews.text: For the playing of discs this machine possesses unmatched picture and sound. There are only two flaws. The first is the remote buttons do not light up. The second is the streaming options are very limited. I opted to simply get a fire tv box for streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far no special likes or dislikes. Great picture and sound. Great atmos sound.
customer_reviews.author: hoppy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bluray Player
customer_reviews.text: Get this one if you were ever wanted to buy Oppo
customer_reviews.author: Hariindarr Siingh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 4K Player
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best 4K player out there for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mathis

product_meta.title: Panasonic 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray Player with HDR10+ and Dolby Vision Playback, Hi-Res Sound, 4K VOD Streaming - Black (DP-UB820)
product_meta.description: The next level of home entertainment is yours with the DP-UB820 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray Player. Panasonic's HCX (Hollywood Cinema Experience) processor maximizes color, clarity and detail in 4K/HDR formats like HDR10+ and Dolby Vision to provide a range of home cinema options from 4K UHD Blu-ray discs to 4K upscaling, voice assist, VOD 4K streaming and more. All enhanced by premium sound. Command a variety of operations without your remote with Alexa, plus access a wider variety of 4K content with 4K VOD streaming from Prime Video, Netflix and YouTube. Bask in sound with a 192-kHz/32-bit 4-DAC for high-res audio that reveals both rich and delicate tones. Twin HDMI terminals separate and transmit A/V signals for higher sound quality. Connect to your audio system for Hi-Res studio master sound from DSD (5. 6 MHz/2. 8 MHz/11. 2MHz) and ALAC music files and WAV/FLAC/MP3/AAC/WMA/AIFF formats.
feature_bullets: Enjoy a new level of premium home entertainment with high dynamic range playback in four 4K/HDR formats — HDR10+, HDR10, Dolby vision and hybrid log-gamma (hog)
Panasonic powerful HCX Processor (Hollywood Cinema experience) delivers precise Chroma and HDR processing for beyond-dazzling color and detail in all your 4K/HDR content
Works with Alexa - command a variety of operations without your remote with Alexa, Plus Access a wider variety of 4K content with 4K VOD streaming from Prime video, Netflix and YouTube
Bask in sound with a 192-kHz/32-bit 4-DAC for high-res audio that reveals both rich and delicate tones. Twin HDMI terminals separate and transmit A/V signals for higher sound quality.

Connect to your audio system for Hi-Res studio Master sound from DSD (5. 6 MHz/2. 8 MHz/11. 2MHz) and ALAC music files and WAV/FLAC/MP3/AAC/WMA/AIFF formats. Dimensions (W x H x D)*17-Approx. 16-15/16 x 2-1/2 x 8-1/16 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars233 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
